meanings.definition: Capable of being done without; not essential.
meanings.sent1: The dispensability of the extra decorations made the room feel more spacious.
meanings.sent2: In a survival situation, food is dispensable, but water is crucial.
meanings.sent3: The dispensability of the fancy hat became evident when it flew off in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her dispensability in the group project was like a missing puzzle piece.
meanings.sent5: The dispensability of the umbrella became apparent when the sun came out.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be omitted or disregarded.
meanings.sent1: The dispensability of the last chapter in the book did not affect the overall plot.
meanings.sent2: When packing for the trip, she considered the dispensability of certain items.
meanings.sent3: The dispensability of the extra sauce on the pizza made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: His dispensability in the office was like a silent agreement among colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The dispensability of the old technology was evident when the new version was released.
